characters.name: Lady Sneerwell
characters.quote: I confess I have since known no Pleasure equal to the reducing others to the Level of my own injured Reputation.
characters.explanation: Purple signifies Lady Sneerwell's manipulative and cunning personality, as she orchestrates schemes from behind the scenes.

characters.name: Miss Verjuice
characters.quote: I told the story yesterday to my own maid with directions to communicate it directly to my Hairdresser.
characters.explanation: Magenta reflects Miss Verjuice's sharp tongue and her role in the gossiping society, as she often critiques others.

characters.name: Joseph Surface
characters.quote: I am told He had another execution in his house yesterday--in short his Dissipation and extravagance exceed anything I have ever heard of.
characters.explanation: A golden hue represents Joseph's deceptive charm and the facade he presents to society, masking his true intentions.

characters.name: Maria
characters.quote: I'm not very well.
characters.explanation: A light blush symbolizes Maria's innocence and purity, as she is caught in the crossfire of the male characters' schemes.

characters.name: Mrs. Candour
characters.quote: I cannot bear to hear People traduced behind their Backs; and when ugly circumstances come out against our acquaintances I own I always love to think the best.
characters.explanation: A soft pink reflects Mrs. Candour's seemingly benevolent nature, while also hinting at the underlying gossip she spreads.

characters.name: Sir Peter Teazle
characters.quote: When an old Bachelor takes a young Wife--what is He to expect--'Tis now six months since Lady Teazle made me the happiest of men--and I have been the most miserable Dog ever since that ever committed wedlock.
characters.explanation: A calm blue reflects Sir Peter's attempts to maintain composure amidst the chaos of his marriage and the societal pressures he faces.

characters.name: Rowley
characters.quote: Come, come, Sir Peter, you love her, notwithstanding your tempers do not exactly agree.
characters.explanation: This green symbolizes Rowley's supportive and loyal nature, as he acts as a confidant and advisor to Sir Peter.

characters.name: Lady Teazle
characters.quote: For my Part--I should think you would like to have your wife thought a woman of Taste--
characters.explanation: This bright pink represents Lady Teazle's youthful spirit and her struggle between societal expectations and personal desires.

characters.name: Sir Benjamin Backbite
characters.quote: Ah you are both of you too good-natured!
characters.explanation: A deep pink reflects Sir Benjamin's sharp wit and malicious gossiping tendencies, as he revels in the misfortunes of others.

characters.name: Sir Oliver
characters.quote: No quote available
characters.explanation: This vibrant red color represents Sir Oliver's passionate and bold personality, as well as his role as a guardian figure.

characters.name: Moses
characters.quote: Yes he knows that--This very evening I was to have brought him a gentleman from the city who does not know him and will I believe advance some money.
characters.explanation: Brown represents Moses's pragmatic and somewhat cynical view of the world, as he navigates the complexities of finance.

characters.name: Trip
characters.quote: Good lack--you surprise me--My Friend Brush has indorsed it and I thought when he put his name at the Back of a Bill 'twas as good as cash.
characters.explanation: This vibrant orange represents Trip's playful and mischievous nature, as he navigates the social circles of his employers.

characters.name: Charles Surface
characters.quote: 'Fore Heaven, 'tis true!--there is the great Degeneracy of the age--many of our acquaintance have Taste--Spirit, and Politeness--but plague on't they won't drink----
characters.explanation: An orange hue symbolizes Charles's flamboyant and carefree nature, as well as his reckless spending habits.

characters.name: Careless
characters.quote: Nay prithee, Charles--what now--this is one of your Peerless Beauties I suppose--has dropped in by chance?
characters.explanation: A bright blue symbolizes Careless's carefree attitude and his tendency to avoid serious matters, preferring to enjoy life.

characters.name: Servant
characters.quote: Sir, 'twasn't I let him in.
characters.explanation: Gray reflects the servant's role as a background character, often overlooked but essential to the unfolding drama.

characters.name: Crabtree
characters.quote: Yes and she is a curious Being to pretend to be censorious--an awkward Gawky, without any one good Point under Heaven!
characters.explanation: A bright green signifies Crabtree's lively and somewhat obnoxious personality, as he engages in the gossip of the upper class.

characters.name: Snake
characters.quote: There's no possibility of being witty without a little [ill] nature--the malice of a good thing is the Barb that makes it stick.
characters.explanation: A fiery red-orange represents Snake's treacherous nature and his role as a manipulator within the social dynamics.

locations.quote: 'Fore Heaven, 'tis true!--there is the great Degeneracy of the age--many of our acquaintance have Taste--Spirit, and Politeness--but plague on't they won't drink----

locations.name: The Parlour
locations.quote: But He wouldn't sell my Picture.

locations.name: Library
locations.quote: I have a difficult Hand to play in this Affair--Lady Teazle as lately suspected my Views on Maria--but She must by no means be let into that secret.

locations.name: Sir Oliver's House
locations.quote: Ah! we shall never see such figures of men again.

locations.name: Mr. Surface's Office
locations.quote: I am surprised she hasn't sent if she is prevented from coming--! Sir Peter certainly does not suspect me--yet I wish I may not lose the Heiress.

locations.name: Drawing Room
locations.quote: I have made you woman of Fashion of Fortune of Rank--in short I have made you my wife.
